summary: This is an email chain from May 21, 2021, discussing coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's suicide and the guards on duty. The email discusses a planned deferred prosecution agreement with the guards and arranging interviews for an OIG report.

persons.name: Chief, Public Corruption Unit
persons.role: Chief of the Public Corruption Unit, U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
persons.context: The author of the initial email, seeking to coordinate with the OIG regarding the Epstein guards investigation and a planned deferred prosecution agreement. They mention plans to file a public letter and arrange guard interviews.

events.title: Email Coordination on Epstein Guard Investigation
events.description: Email correspondence discussing the need to coordinate with the DOJ-OIG regarding the investigation into Epstein's suicide and the guards on duty, including plans for a deferred prosecution agreement and interviews.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was planning to file a public letter regarding a deferred prosecution agreement with the two guards on duty the night of Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.
The two guards had been charged with falsifying records related to Epstein's death.
The guards had agreed to be interviewed by the U.S. Attorney's Office and the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) as part of an ongoing investigation.
There was an OIG investigation into Epstein's suicide expected to lead to a public report, and coordination was needed to confirm the OIG's comfort with referencing it.
The OIG lawyer previously handling the Epstein suicide investigation may have left the office, creating a need to identify a new contact.
